title: Federal Prosecutors Investigated Alleged Bribery-for-Pardon Scheme
sub_head: Justice Department was pursuing an inquiry as recently as this summer, according to court filing
body:
WASHINGTON—The Justice Department was investigating as recently as this summer an alleged “bribery-for-pardon” scheme, according to a court filing made public Tuesday.
The court filing was issued by Beryl A. Howell, the chief judge of the U.S. District Court in Washington, D.C., on Aug. 28. It was unsealed on her order Tuesday in heavily redacted form, with most of the details of the alleged scheme withheld.
Prosecutors...
